section.p:
dà is indeclinable in modern Gaelic (though the form dhà is used in the usual lenited contexts) –
masculine –
nominative – (an) dà bhòrd (the) two tables
dative – air (an) dà bhòrd on (the) two tables
genitive – casan (an) dà bhùird (the) two tables’ legs
feminine –
nominative – (an) dà chraoibh (the) two trees
dative – air (an) dà chraoibh on (the) two trees
genitive – geugan (na) dà chraoibhe (the) two trees’ branches
The Old Gaelic inflected forms dì [feminine nominative] and dibh [dative] are no longer used.

module.p:
dà can be (semantically) modified by the numeric adjective deug -teen, +10, yielding dà ... dheug twelve, 12.
(an) dà bhòrd dheug (the) twelve tables
(an) dà chraoibh dheug (the) twelve trees

dà can be (semantically) modified by the numeric preposition phrase air fhichead twenty–, +20, yielding dà ... air fhichead twenty-two, 22.
(an) dà bhòrd air fhichead (the) twenty-two tables
(an) dà chraoibh air fhichead (the) twenty-two trees

The two numeric modifiers can be combined to give dà ... dheug air fhichead thirty-two, 32.
(an) dà bhòrd dheug air fhichead (the) thirty-two tables
(an) dà chraoibh dheug air fhichead (the) thirty-two trees

section.p: The main use of dà is as the enumerator of a singular countable common noun.

Some examples with masculine nouns –
older pedagogical examples –
Tha dà ràmh air an tràigh. | Tha dà ugh anns an nead. | Tha mi a’ dol sìos do’n abhainn a bhreith air breac. [...] Chunnaic mi trì anns a’ ghlumaig. [...] Tha dà phunnd ’san fhear as mò. td. 5, 22, 69–70

Some examples with feminine nouns –
pedagogical examples –
Tha dà àrdsgoil bheag anns a’ bhaile.
There are two small secondary schools in the town. td. 207
Seo dà cheist nach soirbh am fuasgladh.
Here are two questions that aren’t easy to solve. td. 207
older pedagogical examples –
Tha dà chathair aig an teine agus ceithir cathraichean aig a’ bhòrd. td. 49

Some examples with feminine nouns –
pedagogical examples –
tro dhà uinneig fharsaing àird
through two wide, high windows td. 207

Some examples with dà ... dheug –
Ann an dà bhliadhna dheug sgrìobh e fichead leabhar ’s a h-aon ’s dh’ fhàg e grunn mór phàipearan a chùl air a sin.
In 12 years he [Kierkegaard] wrote 21 books and he left behind a large quantity of papers. td. 103

module.p: dà fhichead forty, 40 (sometimes written as daichead), cf. fichead twenty.

Examples of usage –
Rugadh am feallsanach Soren Kierkegaard ann sa’ bhliadhna 1813, an Copenhagen far na bhàsaich e nuair a bha e dà fhichead, ’s a dhà.
The philosopher Soren Kierkegaard was born in 1813, in Copenhagen where he died when he was 42. td. 103 predicate expression of age, with bliadhna ... de dh’aois understood

Some examples –
Tha e dà uair.
It’s two o’clock. td. 207
Dé an uair a tha e? Tha e dà uair. td. 56 predicate expression of time of day
Tha uair a thìde againn airson na dinneir, agus tha sinn a stigh dà uair a thìde feasgar. td. 61 adverbial expression of duration of time

section.p: dà can be used to express an absolute quantity, introduced by the particle a – a dhà.

Exampls involving subjects –
Co mheud cat a tha ann? Tha a dhà.
How many cats are there? There are two. td. 207

Exampls involving objects –
Chaidh a dhà eile a chumail.
Two others were kept. td. 207

Some examples involving counting –
A h-aon, a dhà, Ciamar a tha? A trì, a ceithir, Brògan leathair: A cóig, a sia, Uisg is feath: A seachd, a h-ochd, Is mi tha bochd: A naoi, a deich, Faic na h-eich: A h-aon deug, a dhà dheug, Brògan gun phàigheadh. | Cia mheud isean a tha [aig a’ chearc]? Cunntais iad. A h-aon, a dhà, a trì, – td. 57, 71
ann an sgeulachd a dhà
in story two td. 207 alternative to ordinal – anns an dàrna sgeulachd

Some other examples –
Bha i ceud bliadhna a dh’ aois is esan dhà air fhichead. Cha robh e ach mìos no dhà a-mach ás an oilthigh. Bha a nighean a’ fuireachd còmhla rithe. Bha ise ceithir fichead. Shaoil e gu robh a’ chailleach ann an dòigh na bu shunndaiche na a nighean. [...]
She was a hundred years old and him twenty two. He was just a month or two out of the university. Her daughter was living with her. She was eighty. He thought that the old woman was in a way livelier than her daughter. [...] td. 169, le Iain Mac a’ Ghobhainn expression of age – bha esan a dhà air fhichead; bha esan dà bhliadhna air fhichead de dh’aois

Some examples involving time –
Tha e gu bhith leth-uair an dèidh (a) dhà.
It’s almost half past two. td. 207
mu chairteal gu a dhà
about a quarter to two td. 207

module.p:
Some examples –
Rugadh am feallsanach Soren Kierkegaard ann sa’ bhliadhna 1813, an Copenhagen far na bhàsaich e nuair a bha e dà fhichead, ’s a dhà.
The philosopher Soren Kierkegaard was born in 1813, in Copenhagen where he died when he was 42. td. 103 predicate expression of age, with bliadhna ... de dh’aois understood

Some examples –
Cha robh aige a-nise ach beathach no (a) dhà.
He had only an animal or two now. td. 207
[...] ’Se glé bheag de chobhair a thug a’ Phàrlamaid a riamh do ’n Ghàidhlig no do fhoghlum agus do litreachas na Gàidhlig. [...] Dé na rudan a dh’ fhaodadh sinn iarraidh? [...] Chan eil an sin ach rud no dhà a dh’ fhaodamaid iarraidh. Tha Comunn nan Croitearan air nì de ’n t-seòrsa so iarraidh mar tha, air a’ Bh.B.C. Thug sin togail inntinn dhuinn. Có a nis a chuireas fead chruaidh ann an cluais Luchd an Ionmhais ann a Westminster?
[...] The Parliament has given very little assistance ever to the Gaelic language or to Gaelic education and literature. [...] What are the things that we could demand? [...] Those are just a couple of things that we could demand. The Crofters’ Society has demanded something of this kind already, on the BBC. That has given us inspiration. Who now will put a hard whistle [?] in the ear of the Finance People in Westminster? td. 105, ‘Air an Spiris’
Bha i ceud bliadhna a dh’ aois is esan dhà air fhichead. Cha robh e ach mìos no dhà a-mach ás an oilthigh. Bha a nighean a’ fuireachd còmhla rithe. Bha ise ceithir fichead. Shaoil e gu robh a’ chailleach ann an dòigh na bu shunndaiche na a nighean. [...]
She was a hundred years old and him twenty two. He was just a month or two out of the university. Her daughter was living with her. She was eighty. He thought that the old woman was in a way livelier than her daughter. [...] td. 169, le Iain Mac a’ Ghobhainn

Some examples –
a’ cur aghaidh air a dhà de cheistean mòra ar n-àma fhìn
confronting two of the great problems of our own time td. 207
Bha a dhà dhiubh sin air a’ bhòrd ri taobh an dorais.
Two of those were on the table by the door. td. 207

module.h: a dhà no a trì de ...
module.p:
Some examples –
Bha a dhà no (a) trì de bhàtaichean eile anns a’ chala.
there were two or three other boats in the harbour. td. 207
a dhà no a trì (de) sheachdainnean air ais
two or three weeks ago td. 207
anns na dhà no (a) trì (de) bhliadhnachan a chaidh
in the past two or three years td. 207

ul.li:
cas
leg ⇒ dà-chasach
two-legged, bipedal ⇒ dà-chasach
a biped

cèile
spouse ⇒ dà-chèileach
bigamous ⇒ dà-chèileach
bigamist ⇒ dà-chèileachas
bigamy

dual
strand, lock of hair ⇒ dà-dhualach
two-ply (yarn)

faobhar
edge (of a knife/sword) ⇒ dà-fhaobharach
double-edged, two-edged

section.p: dà is derived from the Old Gaelic numeral dá.
